reviewText: This is an older movie with a Opal truly the main character.  Sam Elliot is not a cowboy in this but an adventurer. He likes to do the job right or die trying.  Set in Australia Elliot is after the Blue Lighting. the biggest opal found. After being almost killed and the aboriginals save him they join forces with Kate, not only to keep the opal but avenge Kate's husband's brutal murder. A little out dated but very good.

reviewText: Blue Lightning  VHSBlue Lightning starts off like a standard "B" Grade movie, but since it stars my favorite cowboy movie star, Sam Elliott, I kept watching.  It's all about a private investigator, Elliott, hired to recover a sapphire from a treacherous double-dealing villain, played by Robert Culp of I, Spy fame (the TV show).  Interesting movie.Looks like it was shot in Aussie Land.Recommended for fans of Sam Elliott.Gunner  February, 2008

reviewText: Very disapointing actioner possibly due to lacklustre direction from former actor turned director Lee Phillips. As for Robert Culp's Irish accent it proves the point that Irish actors such as Brendan Gleeson and Colin Farrell can do American accents so well.

reviewText: I saw this movie a long time ago and have it on VHS.  I was hoping it would come out on DVD.  I could listen to Sam Elliott speak all day long.  What a voice.  I enjoyed this movie.  It was entertaining and it also had Robert Culp in it.  I think it is definitely worth watching if you are a Sam Elliott fan.
